meanings.definition: To change the direction or position of something.
meanings.sent1: She was reorientating the map to find the correct way.
meanings.sent2: The ship captain was reorientating the compass to navigate the storm.
meanings.sent3: While reorientating the furniture, she accidentally bumped into the wall.
meanings.sent4: The dancer reorientating her body to match the rhythm of the music.
meanings.sent5: The hiker reorientating himself by looking at the position of the sun.

meanings.definition: To adjust or adapt to a new situation or environment.
meanings.sent1: After moving to a new city, she was reorientating herself to the different surroundings.
meanings.sent2: The students were reorientating to the online learning environment.
meanings.sent3: He found himself reorientating to the strange customs of the foreign land.
meanings.sent4: The company was reorientating its marketing strategies to reach a wider audience.
meanings.sent5: The plant was reorientating its leaves to receive more sunlight for photosynthesis.
